nodes.bodyText: are you trying to convey that there are 2 options and the user should pick one of them? i would keep the A and B denotation, explain underneath the options that the user should pick 1, then rename by the subtitles to Option A and Option B. i feel the existing layout is more reasonable since it defines that there are two options, but now they squashed together in this section
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -98,12 +98,15 @@ In order to make sure this works for either local or remote clients, we have to
 Docker network and expose the required ports correctly.
 
 There are two ways to launch Alluxio Docker containers on the Docker host:
- + A. Use host network
- + B. Use user-defined bridge network
+ + Use [host network](https://docs.docker.com/network/host/) to

nodes.bodyText: line too long, not friendly to read in final html output
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -98,18 +98,25 @@ In order to make sure this works for either local or remote clients, we have to
 Docker network and expose the required ports correctly.
 
 There are two ways to launch Alluxio Docker containers on the Docker host:
- + A. Use host network
- + B. Use user-defined bridge network
++ A: Use [host network](https://docs.docker.com/network/host/)
++ B: Use [user-defined bridge network](https://docs.docker.com/network/bridge/)
 
-### A. Launch Docker Alluxio Containers Using Host Network
+Host network shares ip-address and networking namespace between the container and the Docker host.
+User-defined bridge network allows containers connected to communicate,
+while providing isolation from containers not connected to that bridge network.
+For the purpose of test, using host network is sufficient.
 
-```
+### Option A: Launch Docker Alluxio Containers Using Host Network
+
+```console
 # Launch the Alluxio Master
 $ docker run -d --rm \
     --net=host \
     --name=alluxio-master \
     -v /alluxio_ufs:/opt/alluxio/underFSStorage \
-    -e ALLUXIO_JAVA_OPTS="-Dalluxio.master.hostname=$(hostname -i) -Dalluxio.master.mount.table.root.ufs=/opt/alluxio/underFSStorage" \

nodes.bodyText: It is recommended to use host network, option A, for testing.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -98,21 +98,25 @@ In order to make sure this works for either local or remote clients, we have to
 Docker network and expose the required ports correctly.
 
 There are two ways to launch Alluxio Docker containers on the Docker host:
- + Use [host network](https://docs.docker.com/network/host/) to
-  share ip-address and networking namespace between the container and the Docker host.
- + Use [user-defined bridge network](https://docs.docker.com/network/bridge/) to
-  allow containers connected to communicate, while providing isolation from containers which are
-  not connected to that bridge network.
++ A: Use [host network](https://docs.docker.com/network/host/)
++ B: Use [user-defined bridge network](https://docs.docker.com/network/bridge/)
+
+Host network shares ip-address and networking namespace between the container and the Docker host.
+User-defined bridge network allows containers connected to communicate,
+while providing isolation from containers not connected to that bridge network.
+For the purpose of test, using host network is sufficient.

nodes.bodyText: add a OR line between the two lines here to clarify that people should only choose one
